Tasks.Task Description: Identify the data types, volume, and retention policies for the archive storage. Determine access frequency and compliance requirements.
Plan the storage architecture, including the use of storage accounts, containers, and access tiers. Ensure scalability and cost optimization.
Provision a new Azure Storage Account with the required configurations, such as region, redundancy, and performance tier.
Set up the archive tier for the storage account. Define policies for transitioning data to the archive tier based on access patterns.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure access control policies and integrate with Azure Active Directory for authentication.
Configure Azure Monitor and Storage Analytics to track storage usage, access patterns, and performance metrics. Set up alerts for anomalies.
Perform tests to upload data to the archive tier and retrieve it. Validate data integrity and access times.
Review storage usage and access patterns periodically to ensure cost efficiency. Adjust policies for data tiering as needed.
Create detailed documentation for the storage setup, including configurations, policies, and operational procedures.
Train the operations team on managing archive storage, including data upload, retrieval, monitoring, and troubleshooting.
Ensure the archive storage setup complies with regulatory requirements. Schedule regular audits to verify compliance and security measures.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of Archive Storage accounts. Identify and resolve any anomalies or issues.
Perform regular checks to ensure the integrity of archived data using Azure Storage's built-in data integrity features.
Audit and update access policies for Archive Storage accounts to ensure compliance with organizational security standards.
Rotate encryption keys used for Archive Storage accounts to maintain security and compliance with organizational policies.
Perform regular audits of Archive Storage configurations to ensure alignment with best practices and organizational requirements.
Keep documentation for Archive Storage operations up-to-date, including lifecycle policies, access controls, and troubleshooting guides.
Conduct drills to prepare for potential incidents affecting Archive Storage, such as data corruption or retrieval failures.
Ensure lifecycle policies for Archive Storage are configured correctly to move data to the archive tier and delete expired data as needed.
Regularly back up configuration settings for Archive Storage accounts to ensure quick recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Collect feedback from users regarding Archive Storage performance and reliability. Implement improvements based on this feedback.
